@jake_burns18 Schematically this is exactly the type of offense we should be running. Run-first/play-play action pass happy. It fits our skill perfectly. Baker needs to clean up his play-action technique we need help on the oline etc. But there are plenty of reasons to be excited.

@IngramScott8 Agree on the character front. BUT  Chubb has more yards in 2 years than Cook does in 3.   OBJ & Juice are better players than Diggs and Thielen.   Rudolph is the only maybe for me.   Agree Cousins is currently better than Baker but Baker has more talent. Just one man’s opinion.

Seems this is the minority opinion but I believe we’re going to end up loving Stefanski. With far inferior talent he had the Vikings offense at 11th this year.   I don’t think they have a single skill position player that would start on our team. Go Browns!

@MaryKayCabot Assuming this is true Josh and his agent know the decision at this point. No sense keeping it from them if he’s their guy. They’d be hammering out a contract right now.

The loss of innocent life is tragic. We mourn and pray for the families who are suffering today not just those on the plane but the 100s of thousands of others suffering because of the Iranian regime. It is Iran who has made the choice to operate this way. They are responsible.

The Iranian regime is the world’s largest sponsor of terror recently killed an American citizen and laid siege to our embassy. Soleimani was responsible for 600 American deaths and was planning an imminent attack. We took him out and re-established deterrence.

One of the many problems with the false equivalencies and being against everything the President does is it emboldens the Iranian regime of terror.   Case in point - Hours after Pete sends this tweet Iranian foreign minister sends one with near identical sentiment. https://t.co/sYKbMqcjEK https://t.co/gfsLeynK2w

@justinhfunk *Solar panels would be imported not solar itself - obviously

@justinhfunk Solar panels are produced in China wind turbines manufactured in China and the EU minerals used in batteries will be mined in places like the Congo. We don’t do much of this work here in the US.

@justinhfunk Exactly. If you ban fracking you reduce supply of cheap natural gas. You will be forced to switch to other sources which are more expensive. So energy prices will go up. Again the solar wind battery combo is not economical. Energy prices will rise.
@justinhfunk Warren’s plan gets rid of nukes...

@justinhfunk Germany tried the closest thing to Warren’s plan. Shut down nukes and tried to go on solar wind and battery. They’ve spent 10s of billions of dollars and have the highest energy prices in EU while not moving the needle on emissions. Battery tech isn’t anywhere close

@justinhfunk Killing the fracking industry kills jobs. If we went to 100% solar wind and battery that automatically moves jobs overseas. Solar would be imported from China turbine manufacturers are mostly overseas and the minerals used in batteries are mined in places like the Congo

@justinhfunk I’ll respond to each of your points. Certainly not purposefully dishonest or manipulative. I won’t accuse you of the same. I literally love having these debates. I just assume we have a different understanding of energy markets.

Translation: “On my first day as President I will unilaterally raise energy prices kill a bunch of jobs and make sure that we import more energy from abroad.”   (Hint: This also won’t lower carbon emissions if that’s your thing. What backs up gas isn’t usually wind or solar) https://t.co/O7UKVIdAxt
